intro: Stachytarpheta lacunosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities and ability to attract pollinators. Its foliage and flowers provide both aesthetic and ecological benefits in natural and cultivated landscapes.
